Forensic Tools.Name: Autopsy
Forensic Tools.Description: Autopsy is a digital forensics platform and graphical interface to The Sleuth Kit and other digital forensics tools. It is used by law enforcement, military, and corporate examiners to investigate what happened on a computer.
Forensic Tools.HTU: Install Autopsy, create a new case, add data sources (disk images, local disks), and start analyzing the data.

Forensic Tools.Name: FTK Imager
Forensic Tools.Description: FTK Imager is a data preview and imaging tool that lets you quickly assess electronic evidence to determine if further analysis with a forensic tool such as FTK is warranted.
Forensic Tools.HTU: Download and install FTK Imager, create an image of the drive or folder you want to examine, and start the analysis process.

Forensic Tools.Name: Sleuth Kit
Forensic Tools.Description: The Sleuth Kit (TSK) is a library and collection of command-line digital forensics tools that allow you to investigate volume and file system data.
Forensic Tools.HTU: Install The Sleuth Kit, use the command-line tools to analyze disk images, and interpret the output to investigate the data.

Forensic Tools.Name: MiniTool Power Data Recovery
Forensic Tools.Description: MiniTool Power Data Recovery is a free data recovery software for Windows that allows users to recover lost, deleted, or corrupted files from various storage devices.

Forensic Tools.Name: ExifTool
Forensic Tools.Description: ExifTool is a platform-independent Perl library plus a command-line application for reading, writing, and editing meta information in a wide variety of files.
Forensic Tools.HTU: Download and install ExifTool, run the command-line tool with the desired options to read or modify metadata in files.

Network Tools.Name: Wireshark
Network Tools.Description: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer that enables you to capture and interactively browse the traffic running on a computer network.
Network Tools.HTU: Download and install Wireshark, start a network capture, and analyze the captured network data.

Network Tools.Name: Zeek
Network Tools.Description: Zeek is a powerful network analysis framework that is much different from the typical IDS you may know.
Network Tools.HTU: Install Zeek on a network monitoring system, configure it to monitor network traffic, and analyze the logs generated by Zeek.

Network Tools.Name: NetFlow Analyzer
Network Tools.Description: NetFlow Analyzer is a flow-based bandwidth monitoring and traffic analysis tool that helps you monitor network bandwidth and traffic patterns.
Network Tools.HTU: Install NetFlow Analyzer, configure it to collect NetFlow data from network devices, and start analyzing the traffic reports.

Network Tools.Name: Ntopng
Network Tools.Description: Ntopng is a network traffic probe that shows the network usage, similar to what the popular top Unix command does.
Network Tools.HTU: Install Ntopng, configure it to monitor network traffic, and use the web interface to analyze the network usage.

Network Tools.Name: Moloch
Network Tools.Description: Moloch is an open-source, large-scale, full packet capturing, indexing, and database system.
Network Tools.HTU: Install Moloch, set it up to capture network traffic, and use the web interface to search and analyze the captured data.

Malware Analysis Tools.Name: Cuckoo Sandbox
Malware Analysis Tools.Description: Cuckoo Sandbox is an open-source automated malware analysis system.
Malware Analysis Tools.HTU: Install Cuckoo Sandbox, configure it to analyze suspicious files, and review the analysis reports.

Malware Analysis Tools.Name: PEiD
Malware Analysis Tools.Description: PEiD is a program used to detect packers, cryptors, and compilers for PE files. It helps in identifying the packing method of malware.
Malware Analysis Tools.HTU: Download and run PEiD, load the PE file, and view the detected packer information.

Malware Analysis Tools.Name: Ghidra
Malware Analysis Tools.Description: Ghidra is a software reverse engineering (SRE) suite of tools developed by NSA's Research Directorate.
Malware Analysis Tools.HTU: Download and install Ghidra, load a binary file, and use the various tools to analyze and reverse engineer the file.

Malware Analysis Tools.Name: YARA
Malware Analysis Tools.Description: YARA is a tool aimed at helping malware researchers identify and classify malware samples. It uses rule-based pattern matching to find malware..
Malware Analysis Tools.HTU: Install YARA, write rules to match malware patterns, and run YARA against files or directories.

Malware Analysis Tools.Name: Binary Ninja
Malware Analysis Tools.Description: Binary Ninja is a reverse engineering platform that allows users to analyze binary files.
Malware Analysis Tools.HTU: Purchase and install Binary Ninja, load a binary file, and use the platform's tools to analyze and reverse engineer the file.

Vulnerability Scanners.Name: OpenVAS
Vulnerability Scanners.Description: OpenVAS is an open-source vulnerability scanner and management solution that provides comprehensive vulnerability assessment services.
Vulnerability Scanners.HTU: Install OpenVAS, configure target systems, run scans, and analyze the results.

Vulnerability Scanners.Name: Nexpose
Vulnerability Scanners.Description: Nexpose, developed by Rapid7, is a vulnerability scanner that helps in discovering, prioritizing, and remediating vulnerabilities.
Vulnerability Scanners.HTU: Install Nexpose, configure the scan settings, run scans, and review the vulnerability reports.

Vulnerability Scanners.Name: Acunetix
Vulnerability Scanners.Description: Acunetix is a web vulnerability scanner that detects vulnerabilities like SQL Injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in web applications.
Vulnerability Scanners.HTU: Install Acunetix, configure the target web application, run a scan, and analyze the results.

Vulnerability Scanners.Name: Netsparker
Vulnerability Scanners.Description: Netsparker is an automated web application security scanner that identifies vulnerabilities such as SQL Injection and XSS.
Vulnerability Scanners.HTU: Install Netsparker, configure target URLs, run the scan, and review the detailed reports.

Vulnerability Scanners.Name: DEFT
Vulnerability Scanners.Description: DEFT (Digital Evidence & Forensics Toolkit) is a customized distribution of the Ubuntu live Linux, designed for computer forensics and incident response.
Vulnerability Scanners.HTU: Download and boot the DEFT live distribution, use the included tools to perform a forensic analysis of the system.

Packet Sniffers.Name: Wireshark
Packet Sniffers.Description: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer that enables you to capture and interactively browse the traffic running on a computer network.
Packet Sniffers.HTU: Download and install Wireshark, start a network capture, and analyze the captured network data.

Packet Sniffers.Name: tcpdump
Packet Sniffers.Description: tcpdump is a powerful command-line packet analyzer that captures and displays packet data from network interfaces.
Packet Sniffers.HTU: Install tcpdump, run `tcpdump` with appropriate options to capture packets, and analyze the output.

Packet Sniffers.Name: tshark
Packet Sniffers.Description: Tshark is the command-line version of Wireshark, used for capturing and analyzing network packets.
Packet Sniffers.HTU: Install Tshark, run `tshark` to capture and analyze packets from network interfaces.

Packet Sniffers.Name: Ettercap
Packet Sniffers.Description: Ettercap is a comprehensive suite for man-in-the-middle attacks on LAN. It features sniffing of live connections and content filtering.
Packet Sniffers.HTU: Install Ettercap, configure target interfaces, start sniffing, and perform MITM attacks if needed.

Packet Sniffers.Name: Kismet
Packet Sniffers.Description: Kismet is a network detector, packet sniffer, and intrusion detection system for 802.11 wireless LANs.
Packet Sniffers.HTU: Install Kismet, configure wireless interfaces, start capturing wireless packets, and analyze the traffic.

Web Application Scanners.Name: OWASP ZAP
Web Application Scanners.Description: OWASP ZAP is an open-source web application security scanner that helps in finding security vulnerabilities in web applications.
Web Application Scanners.HTU: Install OWASP ZAP, configure the target application, run the scan, and review the results.

Web Application Scanners.Name: Burp Suite
Web Application Scanners.Description: Burp Suite is a popular web vulnerability scanner and security testing toolkit for web applications.
Web Application Scanners.HTU: Install Burp Suite, configure the target URL, run the scan, and analyze the vulnerabilities.

Web Application Scanners.Name: Nikto
Web Application Scanners.Description: Nikto is an open-source web server scanner that performs comprehensive tests against web servers for multiple vulnerabilities.
Web Application Scanners.HTU: Install Nikto, run `nikto -h <target>` to scan the target web server, and review the report.

Web Application Scanners.Name: Acunetix
Web Application Scanners.Description: Acunetix is a web vulnerability scanner that detects and reports on over 4500 web application vulnerabilities.
Web Application Scanners.HTU: Install Acunetix, configure the target web application, run the scan, and review the detailed reports.

Web Application Scanners.Name: Arachni
Web Application Scanners.Description: Arachni is a feature-full, modular, and high-performance web application security scanner framework.
Web Application Scanners.HTU: Install Arachni, configure the target web application, run the scan, and analyze the results.

Password Crackers.Name: John the Ripper
Password Crackers.Description: John the Ripper is a fast password cracker, currently available for many flavors of Unix, Windows, DOS, BeOS, and OpenVMS.
Password Crackers.HTU: Install John the Ripper, run `john <password-file>` to start cracking passwords.

Password Crackers.Name: Hashcat
Password Crackers.Description: Hashcat is the world's fastest and most advanced password recovery utility, supporting various algorithms and attack modes.
Password Crackers.HTU: Install Hashcat, use appropriate commands to crack hashes, e.g., `hashcat -m 0 -a 0 example.hash example.dict`.

Password Crackers.Name: Hydra
Password Crackers.Description: Hydra is a very fast network logon cracker that supports numerous protocols and services to perform brute-force attacks.
Password Crackers.HTU: Install Hydra, configure the target and protocol, run the attack, e.g., `hydra -l user -P passlist.txt ftp://target`.

Password Crackers.Name: Medusa
Password Crackers.Description: Medusa is a speedy, massively parallel, modular, login brute-forcer that supports various protocols.
Password Crackers.HTU: Install Medusa, configure the target and protocol, run the brute-force attack, e.g., `medusa -h target -u user -P passlist -M ssh`.

Password Crackers.Name: CrackStation
Password Crackers.Description: CrackStation is an online password cracking tool that uses a massive database of password hashes to crack passwords.
Password Crackers.HTU: Visit CrackStation's website, enter the hash, and start the cracking process.

Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Name: MISP
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Description: MISP is an open-source threat intelligence platform for sharing, storing, and correlating Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) about malware threats.
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).HTU: Install MISP, configure it for data sharing, and use the web interface to share and analyze threat data.

Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Name: ThreatConnect
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Description: ThreatConnect is a comprehensive threat intelligence platform that integrates threat data, automates processes, and enhances security operations.
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).HTU: Sign up for ThreatConnect, configure data sources, and use the platform to manage and analyze threat intelligence.

Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Name: Open Threat Exchange (OTX)
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Description: OTX is an open-source threat intelligence community that enables collaborative defense with real-time data sharing.
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).HTU: Sign up for OTX, join the community, and access threat data feeds for analysis.

Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Name: PassiveTotal
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Description: PassiveTotal is a threat intelligence platform that provides insights into threat infrastructure using passive DNS data and other sources.
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).HTU: Sign up for PassiveTotal, configure data sources, and use the platform to analyze threat data.

Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Name: OpenCTI
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).Description: OpenCTI is an open-source threat intelligence platform that provides a structured and collaborative environment for threat data analysis.
Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIP).HTU: Install OpenCTI, configure data sources, and use the web interface for threat analysis and sharing.

Social Engineering Tools.Name: Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET)
Social Engineering Tools.Description: SET is an open-source penetration testing framework designed for social engineering attacks.
Social Engineering Tools.HTU: Install SET, run `setoolkit`, and select the desired attack vector from the menu.

Social Engineering Tools.Name: Gophish
Social Engineering Tools.Description: Gophish is an open-source phishing framework designed to make it easy to test and train employees against phishing attacks.
Social Engineering Tools.HTU: Install Gophish, configure phishing campaigns, and launch them to assess user susceptibility.

Social Engineering Tools.Name: King Phisher
Social Engineering Tools.Description: King Phisher is a phishing campaign toolkit used to simulate real-world phishing attacks.
Social Engineering Tools.HTU: Install King Phisher, configure campaigns, and execute phishing simulations.

Social Engineering Tools.Name: Maltego
Social Engineering Tools.Description: Maltego is an open-source intelligence and forensics application that provides data mining and link analysis capabilities.
Social Engineering Tools.HTU: Install Maltego, configure transforms, and use the graphical interface to gather and analyze information.

Social Engineering Tools.Name: Recon-ng
Social Engineering Tools.Description: Recon-ng is a full-featured web reconnaissance framework written in Python, providing modules for various reconnaissance tasks.
Social Engineering Tools.HTU: Install Recon-ng, add and configure modules, and run them to gather information.

Phishing Tools.Name: Gophish
Phishing Tools.Description: Gophish is an open-source phishing framework designed to make it easy to test and train employees against phishing attacks.
Phishing Tools.HTU: Install Gophish, configure phishing campaigns, and launch them to assess user susceptibility.

Phishing Tools.Name: Phishing Frenzy
Phishing Tools.Description: Phishing Frenzy is a fully open-source Ruby on Rails application designed to manage and execute email phishing campaigns.
Phishing Tools.HTU: Install Phishing Frenzy, configure email templates and target lists, and launch phishing campaigns.

Phishing Tools.Name: King Phisher
Phishing Tools.Description: King Phisher is a phishing campaign toolkit used to simulate real-world phishing attacks.
Phishing Tools.HTU: Install King Phisher, configure campaigns, and execute phishing simulations.

Phishing Tools.Name: SET (Social-Engineer Toolkit)
Phishing Tools.Description: SET is an open-source penetration testing framework designed for social engineering attacks, including phishing.
Phishing Tools.HTU: Install SET, run `setoolkit`, and select the desired phishing attack vector from the menu.

Phishing Tools.Name: Evilginx2
Phishing Tools.Description: Evilginx2 is a man-in-the-middle attack framework used for phishing login credentials and session cookies.
Phishing Tools.HTU: Install Evilginx2, configure phishing sites, and use it to capture login credentials and session tokens.

Data Exfiltration Tools.Name: DNSExfiltrator
Data Exfiltration Tools.Description: DNSExfiltrator allows for the exfiltration of data through DNS requests.
Data Exfiltration Tools.HTU: Install DNSExfiltrator, configure the DNS server, and use the tool to exfiltrate data via DNS.

Data Exfiltration Tools.Name: PowerShell Empire
Data Exfiltration Tools.Description: PowerShell Empire is a post-exploitation framework that includes modules for data exfiltration.
Data Exfiltration Tools.HTU: Install Empire, run the PowerShell agent on the target, and use exfiltration modules to extract data.

Data Exfiltration Tools.Name: Covenant
Data Exfiltration Tools.Description: Covenant is a collaborative .NET C2 framework that supports data exfiltration operations.
Data Exfiltration Tools.HTU: Install Covenant, deploy the agent on the target, and use the exfiltration modules to extract data.

Data Exfiltration Tools.Name: dnscat2
Data Exfiltration Tools.Description: dnscat2 is a tool designed to create an encrypted communication channel over the DNS protocol, suitable for data exfiltration.
Data Exfiltration Tools.HTU: Install dnscat2, configure the server and client, and use it to exfiltrate data over DNS.

Data Exfiltration Tools.Name: PoshC2
Data Exfiltration Tools.Description: PoshC2 is a proxy-aware C2 framework that supports data exfiltration among other post-exploitation tasks.
Data Exfiltration Tools.HTU: Install PoshC2, configure and deploy the agent, and use the framework to exfiltrate data.

Network Scanners.Name: Nmap
Network Scanners.Description: Nmap is a versatile open-source network scanner that helps in network discovery and security auditing.
Network Scanners.HTU: Install Nmap, run `nmap <target>` to scan the network, and analyze the results.

Network Scanners.Name: Angry IP Scanner
Network Scanners.Description: Angry IP Scanner is a fast and open-source network scanning tool that is easy to use and provides detailed information.
Network Scanners.HTU: Install Angry IP Scanner, configure the IP range, run the scan, and review the output.

Network Scanners.Name: Advanced IP Scanner
Network Scanners.Description: Advanced IP Scanner is a fast and free network scanner for Windows, providing a comprehensive range of information about network devices.
Network Scanners.HTU: Download and install Advanced IP Scanner, run a scan of the network, and view the detailed information about each device.

Network Scanners.Name: Masscan
Network Scanners.Description: Masscan is an Internet-scale port scanner capable of scanning the entire Internet in under 6 minutes.
Network Scanners.HTU: Install Masscan, run `masscan <target>` with the desired options, and analyze the scan results.

Network Scanners.Name: ZMap
Network Scanners.Description: ZMap is a fast single-packet network scanner designed for Internet-wide network surveys.
Network Scanners.HTU: Install ZMap, configure the target IP range, and run the scan to gather network data.

Steganography Tools.Name: OpenPuff
Steganography Tools.Description: OpenPuff is a professional steganography tool that supports a wide range of carrier formats for embedding data.
Steganography Tools.HTU: Install OpenPuff, choose the carrier file, embed the data, and extract it using the same tool.

Steganography Tools.Name: Steghide
Steganography Tools.Description: Steghide is an open-source steganography tool that allows you to embed data in image and audio files.
Steganography Tools.HTU: Install Steghide, use `steghide embed` to hide data and `steghide extract` to retrieve it.

Steganography Tools.Name: Stegano
Steganography Tools.Description: Stegano is a Python library for hiding messages and files within image files.
Steganography Tools.HTU: Install Stegano using pip, use the library functions to hide and retrieve data from images.

Steganography Tools.Name: LSB-Steganography
Steganography Tools.Description: Hide and Seek is a steganography tool that allows you to hide files within image files.
Steganography Tools.HTU: Install Hide and Seek, choose the carrier image, embed the data file, and extract it using the same tool.

Steganography Tools.Name: OpenStego
Steganography Tools.Description: OpenStego is an open-source steganography tool that provides data hiding and watermarking capabilities.
Steganography Tools.HTU: Install OpenStego, choose the carrier file, embed the data, and extract it using the same tool.

Reverse Engineering Tools.Name: IDA Pro
Reverse Engineering Tools.Description: IDA Pro is an interactive disassembler and debugger, providing comprehensive features for reverse engineering software.
Reverse Engineering Tools.HTU: Install IDA Pro, load the target binary, and use the disassembler and debugger to analyze the code.

Reverse Engineering Tools.Name: Ghidra
Reverse Engineering Tools.Description: Ghidra is a free and open-source software reverse engineering suite developed by the NSA, offering disassembly and decompilation capabilities.
Reverse Engineering Tools.HTU: Install Ghidra, create a new project, load the target binary, and use the tools for analysis.

Reverse Engineering Tools.Name: Radare2
Reverse Engineering Tools.Description: Radare2 is an open-source framework for reverse engineering and analyzing binaries, which includes a debugger and many other tools.
Reverse Engineering Tools.HTU: Install Radare2, load the target binary, and use the commands to analyze and develop exploits.

Reverse Engineering Tools.Name: OllyDbg
Reverse Engineering Tools.Description: OllyDbg is an x86 debugger that emphasizes binary code analysis and is useful for reverse engineering and debugging.
Reverse Engineering Tools.HTU: Install OllyDbg, load the target executable, and use the debugger to analyze the program's behavior.

Reverse Engineering Tools.Name: Capstone
Reverse Engineering Tools.Description: Capstone is a lightweight multi-architecture disassembly framework.
Reverse Engineering Tools.HTU: Install Capstone, integrate it with your reverse engineering tools, and use the API to disassemble binaries.

DDoS Tools.Name: LOIC
DDoS Tools.Description: LOIC is an open-source network stress testing and denial-of-service attack tool.
DDoS Tools.HTU: Download and install LOIC, configure the target URL or IP address, and start the attack.

DDoS Tools.Name: HOIC
DDoS Tools.Description: HOIC is an open-source network stress testing and denial-of-service attack tool that supports multiple targets.
DDoS Tools.HTU: Download and install HOIC, configure the target URLs or IP addresses, and start the attack.

DDoS Tools.Name: HULK
DDoS Tools.Description: HULK is a denial-of-service tool that generates unique and obfuscated HTTP traffic to saturate web servers.
DDoS Tools.HTU: Download HULK, configure the target URL, and run the script to start the attack.

DDoS Tools.Name: Slowloris
DDoS Tools.Description: Slowloris is a tool that allows a single machine to take down a web server with minimal bandwidth by holding many connections open.
DDoS Tools.HTU: Download Slowloris, configure the target server, and run the script to start the attack.

DDoS Tools.Name: Xerxes
DDoS Tools.Description: Xerxes is a powerful denial-of-service tool that can target any web server.
DDoS Tools.HTU: Download Xerxes, compile the code, configure the target server, and run the executable to start the attack.

Encryption Tools.Name: VeraCrypt
Encryption Tools.Description: VeraCrypt is an open-source disk encryption software that provides on-the-fly encryption.
Encryption Tools.HTU: Install VeraCrypt, create an encrypted volume or encrypt a partition/drive, and use it to store sensitive data securely.

Encryption Tools.Name: GnuPG
Encryption Tools.Description: GnuPG is a free implementation of the OpenPGP standard, providing encryption and signing of data and communications.
Encryption Tools.HTU: Install GnuPG, generate a key pair, use `gpg` commands to encrypt/decrypt data, and sign/verify messages.

Encryption Tools.Name: Cryptomator
Encryption Tools.Description: Cryptomator is an open-source encryption tool for cloud storage that provides transparent client-side encryption of files.
Encryption Tools.HTU: Install Cryptomator, create a vault, add files to the vault, and access them securely through the virtual drive.

Encryption Tools.Name: EncFS
Encryption Tools.Description: EncFS is an open-source cryptographic filesystem that provides encryption for directories and files.
Encryption Tools.HTU: Install EncFS, create an encrypted directory, and use it to securely store files.

Encryption Tools.Name: DiskCryptor
Encryption Tools.Description: DiskCryptor is an open-source disk encryption tool that supports full disk and partition encryption.
Encryption Tools.HTU: Install DiskCryptor, choose the disk or partition to encrypt, and follow the steps to complete the encryption process.

Sandboxing Tools.Name: Firejail
Sandboxing Tools.Description: Firejail is a SUID program that reduces the risk of security breaches by restricting the running environment of untrusted applications.
Sandboxing Tools.HTU: Install Firejail, run applications with Firejail to isolate them from the rest of the system.

Sandboxing Tools.Name: Qubes OS
Sandboxing Tools.Description: Qubes OS is a security-focused operating system that uses virtualization to create isolated compartments called qubes.
Sandboxing Tools.HTU: Install Qubes OS, create and manage qubes, and run applications in isolated qubes.

Sandboxing Tools.Name: Gvisor
Sandboxing Tools.Description: Gvisor is a user-space kernel, written in Go, that provides an additional layer of isolation between running applications and the host kernel.
Sandboxing Tools.HTU: Install Gvisor, configure it to run containers, and isolate applications from the host system.

Sandboxing Tools.Name: Shadow Daemon
Sandboxing Tools.Description: Shadow Daemon is a collection of tools to detect, record, and prevent web attacks by isolating and analyzing web application traffic.
Sandboxing Tools.HTU: Install Shadow Daemon, configure it with your web server, and monitor web traffic for malicious activities.

Sandboxing Tools.Name: Snappy
Sandboxing Tools.Description: Snappy is a software deployment and package management system that uses containerization to isolate applications from the system.
Sandboxing Tools.HTU: Install Snappy, package applications as snaps, and run them in isolated environments.
